tool.name: tool_0

param.name: COAST_INITIAL
param.dialogReference:
User Defined Coastline Points

Shapes, input, optional

optional

if non empty, cliffmetric will use the user defined coastal line to draw the transects

param.name: CoastSeaHandiness
param.dialogReference:
Sea handiness

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] right

[1] left

Default: 0

as you traverse the coastline, on which side of shoreline the sea is?

param.name: StartEdgeUserCoastLine
param.dialogReference:
Start edge coastline

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] North

[1] East

[2] South

[3] West

Default: 0

on which edge of the DTM the start of coastline is?

param.name: EndEdgeUserCoastLine
param.dialogReference:
End edge coastline

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] North

[1] East

[2] South

[3] West

Default: 0

on which edge of the DTM the end of coastline is?

param.name: StillWaterLevel
param.dialogReference:
Still Water Level

Floating point

Minimum: 0.000000

Default: 1.000000

Still water level (m) used to extract the shoreline.

param.name: CoastSmooth
param.dialogReference:
Coastline Smoothing Algorithm

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] none

[1] running mean

[2] Savitsky-Golay

Default: 1

Vector coastline smoothing algorithm.

param.name: CoastSmoothWindow
param.dialogReference:
Coastline Smoothing Window Size

Integer

Minimum: 1

Default: 30

Size of coastline smoothing window, resulting kernel size will be: 1 + 2 * size.

param.name: SavGolCoastPoly
param.dialogReference:
Polynomial Order for Savitsky-Golay

Integer

Minimum: 1

Maximum: 6

Default: 4

Order of coastline profile smoothing polynomial for Savitsky-Golay smoothing: usually 2 or 4, max is 6.

param.name: ScaleRasterOutput
param.dialogReference:
Scale Raster Output Values

Boolean

Default: 1

If needed, scale GIS raster output values.

param.name: RandomCoastEdgeSearch
param.dialogReference:
Random Edge for Coastline Search

Boolean

Default: 1

Random edge for coastline search.

param.name: CoastNormalLength
param.dialogReference:
Length of Coastline Normals

Floating point

Minimum: 0.010000

Default: 500.000000

Length of coastline normals (m).

param.name: EleTolerance
param.dialogReference:
Vertical Tolerance

Floating point

Minimum: 0.010000

Default: 0.500000

Vertical tolerance to avoid false cliff tops and toes.

tool.summary: CliffMetrics (Automatic Cliff Metrics delineation) delineates the location of the coastline, coastline normals, and cliff top and toe location along these normals.

idCitation.resTitle: SAGA Interface by O.Conrad (c) 2019, CliffMetrics by Payo et al. (c) 2018

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Conrad, O., Bechtel, B., Bock, M., Dietrich, H., Fischer, E., Gerlitz, L., Wehberg, J., Wichmann, V., and Boehner, J. (2015): System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses (SAGA) v. 2.1.4, Geosci. Model Dev., 8, 1991-2007, doi:10.5194/gmd-8-1991-2015. [SAGA - System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses - saga-gis.org]
